channel.description: Recent content in Example Title on

item.description: Experience Points
Character Creation You are a devoted follower of a [[DnDominions/Dominions Players/Creating a Pretender|pretender]], having heard their whisperings at the end of the Age of Calamity.

Alchemist Your default bomb damage is determined by the highest elemental Path your pretender knows. Additionally any methods of changing your bomb damage have an extra pre-requisite that your pretender must have at least 1 in the corresponding elemental path.
Hit Die: d8 Skill Ranks: 2 + Int Class Skills: Appraise, Craft BAB: Medium (3/4 level) Saves: Good will, good fortitude and poor reflex
Hit Die: d6 Skill Ranks: 2 + Int Class Skills: Appraise, Craft BAB: Low (1/2 level) Saves: Good will, bad fortitude and reflex
The pantokrator is dead and the world stands on the precipice. Will it fall into decay and ruin or will another god rise to power and found a new pantheon?
Levels of Divine Power Divine Power is similar to paths of magic in that increasing levels grant increased potency, along with access to additional effects.
Dominion Dominion is the strength of your pretender’s influence on a given region. This spreads as their influence spreads, temples constructed, deeds extolled, and Thrones captured.
Armor Damage reduction
The Paths of Magic represent knowledge of the fundamental mysteries of the universe. These are represented by levels in the various paths which determine how strong a given caster is.
Intro what its about what to do #TODO

Arcoscephale prefers Heat 0 Cultural Paths: Nature, Air Citizen of the Acropolis Size: medium Choose two ability scores to increase by 2 Bonus Feat The Golden Era: #TODO dominion scrying Ermor prefers Heat 0 Cultural Paths: Fire, Death, Astral Ermorian Citizen
Alteration 1 [!spell] Aim Path: Air 1 Casting Time: 1 round Fatigue Cost: 5 Range: self Grants caster +6 bonus on all ranged attack rolls
Conjuration None Alteration [!spell] Air Shield Path: Air 1 Casting Time: 1 round Fatigue Cost: 10 Winds swirl about the caster, all mundane missiles have an 80% chance to be deflected.
Magic Items Most characters can use one set of boots, armor, headpiece, and up to two other magic items. Forging a magic item requires
[!spell] Hand of Flame School: Evocation 1 Path: Fire 1 Rarity: Common Casting Time: 1 round Cost: 5 Range: self With the flick of an upturned palm the caster conjures a flame in their hand.

[!spell] Detect Connection School: Thaumaturgy 1 Path: Astral 1 Rarity: Common Casting Time: 1 round Cost: 10 Range: touch The caster is able to detect an arcane connection between two things by bridging the gap between them.

Attributes are special features which convey a unique bonus. Listed alphabetically. Glamour all stealth checks rolled twice, taking the better result gain 2 Mirror Images at the start of any combat Magic Tattoo Bear: +4 strength Wolf: +1 base attack bonus Boar: DR 3/- Horse: +2 dodge bonus to AC and +10 combat speed Snake: +2 magic resistance
As the seasons turn commanders can undertake long term projects to aid their cause. Each of these takes half of a season.
Fatigue Penalties from fatigue depend on your Constitution score, which sets the threshold for when additional effects occur as multiples of this score.
Command troops
Leadership
1 2 3 4 5 id: Hambleton image: [[hexmap.png]] bounds: - [0, 0] - [192, 256]
Elek-Nor was a dark sorcerer of evil intent and mischievous demeanor, who decided to inflict his eponymous book on the realms with a canny spell.

The gilded arrows are enchanted to slay a particular creature, their name engraved upon the length of the glistening shaft. Each archer in a company carries one such arrow, and only they know its intended target.
#Ars Every spell made of a technique and a domain. Techniques Create Command Reveal Alter Destroy Imbue Domains

This spell calls forth a group of laughing demon-faced beings, to cause mischief at the summoner’s behest. Conjure Cackling Demons #DCC Level: 2 Range: Varies Duration: Varies Casting time: 1 turn Save: Will vs.
Those with truespeech are able to communicate with nearly anyone else they come across who use spoken language. Those hearing them understand their words as being from their own speech.
The porter spell conjures a nearly invisible floating surface which is able to lift and carry objects on behalf of the caster.
The caster uses secret knowledge to grant this blessing to a traveler. So long as they remain on a marked path, harm cannot befall them.
Invoking this ritual requires the true name or a sample of the subject alongside one hundred pounds of fresh red meat.
The subtle caltrop is a spell of incredibly minor potency, only notable due to the sheet cleverness of its construction and specificity of its spitefulness.
1 2 3 4 5 id: Hambleton image: [[Maps/TheRealms.png]] bounds: - [0, 0] - [75, 75]
The Amalgam A terrifying combination of man, beast, and material - the amalgam is all that remains of Harlan the Alchemist after inventing [[The Prime Acid]].
Blackflame ghouls are the animated corpses of people slain by insidious blackflame, now risen as unrelenting creatures of rage and savagery.
Str: 16 Dex: 18 Con: 8 Int: - Wis: 4 Cha: 10 Abilities 1 monster: Brain Wasp
Cackling Demon #DCC Str Cackling Demon #ArsMagica Might Cackling Demon #d100
Cursed to always battle, never accepting quarter or engaging in diplomacy. Tongue is a dagger, cannot speak, but can spit knives at range.
1 monster: Manticore Devil’s Garden
Every night above the water a ghostly shimmering city appears. Distant figures stroll its wide promenades and dance to faint music at the very edge of hearing.
[[Identifying Potions|Properties]]: viscous black ashy dust If applied under and around the eyes graysight allows the user to see the outlines of nearby objects.
Labyrinth, also known as the City on the Edge of Anywhere, is a city which travels between the realms.
Potions include any of a number of alchemical substances and their intermediates. An initial inspection of physical properties can provide some clue as to the nature of the substance in question.
Places of power are locations where mystical energies converge. can be used by wizards to gather essence if they can control the place

Working in the lab #ArsMagica Nexus of Power A nexus of power is a place where magical energies converge, sourced from the surrounding regions, the caster’s own soul, and the places of power they control.
Details what will happen on a given day in a given place, if no one opens it Chart for random scroll, time and place #TODO

Overview spend 7 points to determine class, ability scores, and heritage collaborate with your group to pick a background There are some notable differences for the War of the Immortals from other campaigns.

The typical alchemist kit includes the tools of their trade, requiring accurate weights and measures be taken caustic or elusive liquids can be handled access to samples of all base metals able to boil, distill, assay, calcinate, dissolve, conjoin, or ferment as required Alchemy Rough transmutation - using a few hours and the tools of their trade (a camp action) an alchemist may perform a “rough” transmutation; an inefficient but fairly universal process.
Robrarian
Shapeshifting shape as template?
Robfighter
Hit Die: d6 Skill Ranks: 2 + Int Class Skills: Appraise, Craft BAB: Low (1/2 level) Saves: Good will, bad fortitude and reflex
Vaccines, proofs against particular disease or poison
Purchasing
Making a character

Alteration is the magic of change. Circles The First Circle of Alteration [!spell] Charm School: Alteration 1 Source: Water 1 Occlusion: Common Casting Time: 1 action Cost: 6 fatigue, 1 gem Range: Touch or Gaze Changes the mind of a target to be friendly towards the caster for one hour unless a will save is made.
Creating things Nature of Conjuration Life matrix Illusions
Nature of Evocation Circles The First Circle of Evocation

Overview As an introduction, the most important aspects for a starting character are to note your [[#Intrinsic Effects]] as bonuses, and see what spells you can cast with [[War Of The Immortals/Magic/Universal Magic|Universal Magic]].
Mark Recall Spirit Sight

The thaumaturgy is a difficult to pin down worker of the arcane arts. Although many wizards acquire some knowledge of thaumaturgy as a way to collaborate with their fellow or divine secrets of the universe, its true extent can be opaque to many.

Universal spells are the 0th level Circles of each of the schools of magic, and available to all spellcasters, although they still require access to the appropriate sources of arcane potency to actually cast them.
Spider able to animate its own exoskeleton, can keep old ones (roll for different sizes?). Hunts with them, connected via thread, uses for thread, no upper bound on growth
Grey matter is a sluggish type of ooze capable of spreading over large areas and emits a mental force affecting all nearby creatures.
Snake with eyes all around #todo
Fatigue
A half-melted fountain seems composed of a mad array of every architectural style and sprays forth a glimmering cloying oil. Being submerged in this substances leaves those who do so forever changed.
The monks of this scriptorium know the perils of the dead, and have taken an oath never to allow the words of the dead to be known by the living.
Every night above the water a ghostly shimmering city appears. Distant figures stroll its wide promenades and dance to faint music at the very edge of hearing.
Veins burn as deadly anathema rips through flesh and organs fail! As soon as even a drop of venom touches someone they embark on a journey which few return from.
Class skills
The passage and tracking of time is an important aspect of every character’s journey. On the smallest scale rounds of combat are individual moments.

item.title: The Prime Acid
item.description: [[Identifying Potions|Properties]]: superfluidic clear grayish flavorless liquid The Prime Acid, known also as oil of blending is a thin superfluidic liquid that does far more than eat away base substance as other acids do.
